page.title: 01CHARMINSTER PARISH - EAST
page.content: Charminster Parish is part of the West Dorset area. The village is in rural surroundings. Land to the east, west and north is mainly agricultural, with Dorchester, the county town, just 1\ miles south across the water meadows of the Rivers Frome and Cerne. The eastern edge of the parish is formed by the boundaries with Piddlehinton and Puddletown. Further north is the boundary with Cerne Abbas. The area links the Cerne Valley to the Piddle Valley - an expanse of gentle hills and wide sweeps of farmland. The western edge of this area is bordered by the Old Sherborne Road (C12) linking Dorchester with Sherborne. At the eastern edge is the B3143. The only other road (C128) cuts east to west through the grounds of Herrison Hospital.
